TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CacheEntryUpdateArguments extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides information about a cache entry that will be removed from the cache.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The arguments in the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments> class contain details about an entry that the cache implementation is about to remove. The arguments include a key to the cache entry, a reference to the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache> instance that the entry will be removed from, a reason for the removal, and the region name in the cache that contains the entry. The constructor of the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments> class uses these arguments to create a new instance of the class.
A <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments> object is passed to a <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateCallback> handler, which notifies the cache about the entry to remove.

block.para: A callback handler must notify the cache implementation whether to insert a replacement entry into the cache in place of the cache entry that is about to be removed. If you want to exchange cache entries, you must assign a value other than to the property. Cache implementations will interpret a value for the property as a notice that the current cache entry should be removed but not replaced.

MemberSignature.Value: public CacheEntryUpdateArguments (System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache source, System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason reason, string key, string regionName);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache source, valuetype System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason reason, string key, string regionName) cil managed

Docs.param: The instance from which the cache entry referenced by key will be removed.
One of the enumeration values that indicate why the cache entry will be removed.
The key of the cache entry that will be removed.
The name of the region in the cache to remove the cache entry from. This parameter is optional. If cache regions are not defined, regionName must be .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the unique identifier for a cache entry that is about to be removed.
Docs.value: The unique identifier for the cache entry.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of a region in the cache that contains a cache entry.
Docs.value: The name of a region in the cache. If regions are not used, this value is .

Docs.summary: Gets the reason that a cache entry is about to be removed from the cache.
Docs.value: One of the enumeration values that describes why a cache entry is being removed.

Docs.summary: Gets a reference to the instance that contains a cache entry that is about to be removed.
Docs.value: A reference to the cache instance.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the value of entry that is used to update the cache object.
Docs.value: The cache entry to update in the cache object. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you want to exchange a cache entry that is about to be removed for an updated cache entry, you must assign a <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem> object to the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.UpdatedCacheItem%2A> property and assign a <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy> object to the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.UpdatedCacheItemPolicy%2A> property. The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem> value must be a value other than `null`. Cache implementations will interpret a `null` value for the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.UpdatedCacheItem%2A> property as a notice that the current cache entry should be removed but not replaced.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the cache eviction or expiration policy of the entry that is updated.
Docs.value: The cache eviction or expiration policy of the cache item that was updated. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If you want to replace a cache entry that is about to be removed with an updated cache entry, you can optionally assign a <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy> object to the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.UpdatedCacheItemPolicy%2A> property. The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy> object enables you to specify cache policy (such as expiration details) for the updated cache entry.
For more information about how to replace a removed cache entry by using an updated one, see the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments> class overview and the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.UpdatedCacheItem%2A> property.
